Persistence metric: stickiness

Getting started

“Stickiness” is a persistence metric introduced in 2012 that longitudinally tracks all students who contact an instructional program to determine the percentage who “stick” to that program and graduate in it.1

Stickiness is defined as the ratio of the number of students graduating in a program to the number of students ever enrolled in the program. In this article, we illustrate how to use midfieldr to compute and compare the stickiness of several programs. The workflow outline:

  • select programs
  • tally ever-enrolled students
  • tally graduating students
  • compute stickiness
  • graph stickiness

In our example, the findings are disaggregated by program, sex, and race/ethnicity because our research questions focus on intersectionality. In your own work, the decision to disaggregate on any variable (or not) is yours.

lasylt,

library(midfieldr)       # cip data and midfieldr functions
library(midfieldstudent) # student demographics and degree data
library(midfieldterm)    # term data

Select programs

For this example, we compare the stickiness of four engineering programs: Civil, Electrical, Industrial, and Mechanical. Their CIP codes were found by keyword search as illustrated in Selecting academic fields of study.

Use cip_filter() to obtain the relevant program codes followed by add_column() to label the group of programs. These labels are handy later when we group and summarize the data.

library(dplyr)
library(tibble)
cve <- cip_filter("^1408") %>% add_column(PGRM = "CVE")
ele <- cip_filter("^1410") %>% add_column(PGRM = "ELE")
ise <- cip_filter("^1435") %>% add_column(PGRM = "ISE")
mce <- cip_filter("^1419") %>% add_column(PGRM = "MCE")

Bind the program data sets into one data frame and discard all but two variables.

# bind the four programs
programs <- bind_rows(cve, ele, ise, mce) %>% 
    select(CIP6, PGRM)

glimpse(programs)
#> Observations: 12
#> Variables: 2
#> $ CIP6 <chr> "140801", "140802", "140803", "140804", "140805", "140899...
#> $ PGRM <chr> "CVE", "CVE", "CVE", "CVE", "CVE", "CVE", "ELE", "ELE", "...
  • The CIP6 variable contains the patterns looked for using str_detect() on the term dataset.
  • The PGRM variable will be used to group and summarize the student data.

Tally students ever enrolled

We use the term dataset to filter for students ever enrolled in a program.

glimpse(term)
#> Observations: 1,136,957
#> Variables: 22
#> $ MID              <dbl> 820100107, 820100135, 820100135, 820100156, 8...
#> $ TYEAR            <dbl> 2005, 1998, 1999, 1993, 1993, 1993, 1992, 199...
#> $ ENRSTAT          <chr> "NEW", "TRNS", "CONT", "CONT", "CONT", "CONT"...
#> $ TDESC            <chr> "Open Option Seeking Business", "Social Work"...
#> $ INSTCODE         <chr> "XB42", "SW01", "SW01", "FW02", "FW02", "FW02...
#> $ TERMGPA          <dbl> 1.589, 3.307, 3.417, 0.000, 0.003, 2.944, 0.0...
#> $ CUMGPA           <dbl> 1.6, 3.3, 3.4, 3.4, 3.3, 3.4, 0.4, 3.3, 3.9, ...
#> $ COOP             <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N...
#> $ ONOFFCAMPUS      <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N...
#> $ TTERM            <chr> "FA", "FA", "SP", "SM", "FA", "SP", "FA", "SP...
#> $ INSTITUTION      <chr> "Institution 1", "Institution 1", "Institutio...
#> $ TCIP             <chr> "999999", "440701", "440701", "030601", "0306...
#> $ STULEVEL         <chr> "FR", "SO", "SO", "SR", "SR", "SR", "SO", "SR...
#> $ ACADEMICSTANDING <chr> "Good Standing", "Good Standing", "Good Stand...
#> $ TCODE            <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N...
#> $ TCIP2            <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N...
#> $ TDESC2           <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N...
#> $ TCODE2           <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N...
#> $ TCIP3            <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N...
#> $ TDESC3           <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N...
#> $ TCODE3           <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N...
#> $ BEGINYEAR        <dbl> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N...

In term:

  • MID a unique student identifier
  • TCIP a program in which a student is enrolled in a term
  • TCIP2 a second program if the student is enrolled in two programs in the same term
  • TCIP3 a third program if the student is enrolled in three programs in the same term
library(tidyr)
ever <- term %>% 
    select(MID, INSTITUTION, TCIP, TCIP2, TCIP3) %>% 
    gather(N, CIP6, TCIP:TCIP3) %>% 
    unique()

glimpse(ever)
#> Observations: 608,692
#> Variables: 4
#> $ MID         <dbl> 820100107, 820100135, 820100156, 820100163, 820100...
#> $ INSTITUTION <chr> "Institution 1", "Institution 1", "Institution 1",...
#> $ N           <chr> "TCIP", "TCIP", "TCIP", "TCIP", "TCIP", "TCIP", "T...
#> $ CIP6        <chr> "999999", "440701", "030601", "999999", "150612", ...

Filter ever, keep rows with CIP6 that match those in programs

library(stringr)
series <- str_c(programs$CIP6, collapse = "|")
ever   <- ever %>% 
    filter(str_detect(CIP6, series)) %>% 
    unique()

ever <- left_join(ever, programs) %>% 
    arrange(CIP6)
#> Joining, by = "CIP6"
ever <- ever[complete.cases(ever), ]

glimpse(ever)
#> Observations: 10,412
#> Variables: 5
#> $ MID         <dbl> 820102025, 820103243, 820109151, 820109683, 820114...
#> $ INSTITUTION <chr> "Institution 1", "Institution 1", "Institution 1",...
#> $ N           <chr> "TCIP", "TCIP", "TCIP", "TCIP", "TCIP", "TCIP", "T...
#> $ CIP6        <chr> "140801", "140801", "140801", "140801", "140801", ...
#> $ PGRM        <chr> "CVE", "CVE", "CVE", "CVE", "CVE", "CVE", "CVE", "...
dim(ever)
#> [1] 10412     5
length(unique(ever$MID))
#> [1] 10054
